Page0.PageText: Man, from all the given evidence and testimonials, the duke seems to be such a jerk!

Page2.PageText: It wouldn't do us any good putting down the duke.

Page4.PageText: From our investigations, most of the evidence points toward Miyuki being the culprit.

Page5.PageText: The way she acts is so mysterious… Her alibis are weaker compared to everyone else… She potentially has ties to a group that HAS killed before…

Page6.PageText: Also, doesn't she sound like she's been flirting with you during all the interrogations? Y'know, calling you deary and laughing despite the circumstances.

Page7.PageText: Sleuthey, what did I just say about making rude remarks about others?

Page8.PageText: …Although I do agree with you. She seemed unnaturally calm during the interrogations, unlike all the other suspects who were shown hints of nervousness or even anger.

Page9.PageText: Just then, Miyuki appears behind the both of them.

Page10.PageText: Detective, I have a few things I would like to tell you regarding this case.

Page11.PageText: Oh, is that so? Sleuthey and I are all ears.

Page13.PageText: Just me? It would be better if the both of us could listen to your testimonial.

Page14.PageText: This doesn't concern her. I would like to only speak with you, detective.

Page15.PageText: ...May I have a private talk with my assistant for a while?

Page16.PageText: The 2 turn away from the fox.

Page18.PageText: This is TOTALLY sus! She's TOTALLY trying to kill you before you give a verdict on the investigation!

Page20.PageText: …But it is incredibly suspicious of her.

Page22.PageText: Sleuthey… If I don't return in 2 minutes, call for backup.

Page23.PageText: What??? You're going to listen to her???

Page24.PageText: Logically, this DOES seem like a terrible idea…

Page25.PageText: But I have a feeling that whatever she has to say is important.

Page28.PageText: You have 2 minutes to say your piece.

Page31.PageText: ...I'll get straight to the point, then.

Page32.PageText: Considering the number of times you called to interrogate me, I presume that I'm currently the most likely culprit from your investigations.

Page34.PageText: I'd like to defend myself with some… information that you may find useful.

Page35.PageText: Miyuki hands over some papers and photographs.

Page37.PageText: Why don't you read through them yourself?

Page38.PageText: The detective looks through the paper, occasionally eyeing Miyuki.

Page39.PageText: More articles about the duke's worker abusing?

Page42.PageText: The detective continues reading through the article.

Page43.PageText: A murder? Beaten to death by the duke…

Page44.PageText: That's right. The duke's abuse has escalated beyond just physical injuries before.

Page45.PageText: However, he covers up everything with his abundant wealth. Truly disgusting.

Page46.PageText: This article states that she had a daughter who was sent to an orphanage…

Page51.PageText: Where did you find this article?

Page52.PageText: My connections reached “The Daily Mail”, and they found an unreleased issue of the news.

Page53.PageText: You can verify it with them. This article had sources and all. But it never reached the light of day.

Page54.PageText: …Why didn't you hand this to the authorities?

Page55.PageText: Believe me, I would have LOVED to.

Page58.PageText: He told me that if I leaked his secrets, he would leak mine.

Page59.PageText: …Does this mean that you really are the head of the Yakuza?

Page60.PageText: Hoho! Nice try detective! I won't be confessing like that!

Page61.PageText: Regardless of the truth of that information, it would have tarnished my reputation and brand if it was spread by such an influential man.

Page62.PageText: Of course, I had no choice but to comply.

Page64.PageText: I'm not saying that your assistant did it…

Page65.PageText: She may not be one to act in revenge like that.

Page66.PageText: …But take this information as you will, detective.

Page68.PageText: Miyuki leaves the room, allowing both the detective and the assistant to continue looking over the investigation.

Page69.PageText: Later on, they gathered everyone in the mansion lobby.

Page70.PageText: Our investigations have finished, and we have come to a conclusion.

Page74.PageText: However, upon further investigations, the evidence proved them to be innocent.

Page75.PageText: After being declared innocent, the former suspect sued the detective for defamation.

Page76.PageText: This left the detective bankrupt and shamed.

Page77.PageText: The murderer is still out there.

Page79.PageText: Ms Miyuki Kitsuki, you are under arrest for the murder of Duke Anton von Affluenton!

Page80.PageText: Hmm… A disappointing conclusion… But I suppose it was to be predicted.

Page81.PageText: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

Page82.PageText: Miyuki was taken to trial, where she was found guilty.

Page83.PageText: It was a job well done by the detective, but…

Page84.PageText: We did it Magnum! Another job well done! Let's go celebrate!

Page86.PageText: What's up? Why are you still brooding at your desk?

Page87.PageText: Something still feels… off about this whole case.

Page88.PageText: The evidence all pointed to Ms Miyuki Kitsuki as the culprit, but I feel like we… Missed something.

Page90.PageText: Isn't this like, your hundredth case or something? Since when have you gotten so attached to a criminal?

Page91.PageText: What, did her flirting attempts actually do a number on you or something?

Page93.PageText: *Sighs* I guess… I'm just overthinking things?

Page94.PageText: --Ending 3 out of 4: Another Day At The Office.--

Page96.PageText: Oh come on, detective! Stop joking around like that!

Page97.PageText: Handing the verdict is a very important and serious thing!

Page100.PageText: …Don't make this any harder for me to do this.

Page104.PageText: Ms Sleuthey, you murdered the Duke Anton Affluenton!

Page109.PageText: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

Page111.PageText: You truly are the best detective the police force has!

Page112.PageText: Sleuthey was taken to trial, where she was found guilty.

Page113.PageText: It was a job well done by the detective, but…

Page115.PageText: (She dedicated her whole life for revenge against the man who murdered her mother…)

Page116.PageText: (I'm glad I was able to uncover the whole truth behind this case, but…)

Page119.PageText: Sarge… I didn't know you were coming.

Page120.PageText: No worries, it's nothing formal. I'm just worried about you.

Page121.PageText: Ever since that day, you've been pretty…

Page122.PageText: Don't worry about me, sarge. I'll… get over it.

Page124.PageText: The former suspects from the crime scene all came to thank you.

Page126.PageText: The door to the office swung open, and all of the former suspects entered.

Page128.PageText: You were REALLY annoying that day! But thanks to you, all of that jerk's stalking shenanigans were exposed!

Page129.PageText: All that media really benefited my company, lol.

Page130.PageText: His wrongdoings as a shareholder was exposed, and it saved my reputation and company!

Page131.PageText: It's all thanks to you for uncovering the truth. Thanks!

Page132.PageText: Affluenpool fell apart after the whole fiasco.

Page133.PageText: I was initially worried about what would happen to me, but I was almost immediately taken in by another club!

Page134.PageText: Turns out they had their eye on me this whole time, and were looking for an opportunity to sign me on for a better contract!

Page135.PageText: I'm doing much better now, thanks!

Page136.PageText: All of the staff of the duke were let go for… obvious reasons.

Page137.PageText: It was a little worrying for all of us, but Ms Kitsuki took us all in as servants for her own mansion.

Page138.PageText: The working environment was much better than with the duke, and we are all receiving better pay and benefits.

Page139.PageText: On the behalf of all the duke's former staff, we thank you.

Page140.PageText: Were you feeling upset over your assistant's arrest?

Page141.PageText: Perhaps you feel that you had betrayed her trust, or gotten in the way of some deserved justice?

Page143.PageText: Think about it this way, detective…

Page144.PageText: She lived her whole life with nothing but vengeance in her mind. Unwavering, rage-filled vengeance that she had wanted nothing more to take out on the duke.

Page145.PageText: Now that she's done the deed, what would she feel without any of that anger?

Page148.PageText: If you hadn't arrested her, she'd probably be filled with remorse for the rest of her life.

Page149.PageText: Although she's been sentenced to lifetime prison, she probably will be able to finally be happy.

Page150.PageText: And look around you! Everyone is happy that the truth prevailed. Is that not a good thing, detective?
